verses.verse: And so as Christ has suffered in the flesh for us, equip yourselves in the same way with the same attitude, for he who has suffered in the flesh wants nothing to do with sin,
so that he should no longer live the rest of [his] life in the flesh [yielding] to the lusts of men but to the will of God.

For in times gone by, it may have satisfied us to have done the will of the heathen, when we lead our life in sexual promiscuity, evil desires, drunkenness, carousings, drinking parties, and depraved idolatries.
They think it strange in that you don't rush into the same excessive unrestrained actions, [and so] start cursing you.
They will give an account to him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
For it was for this reason the gospel was also preached to those who are dead, that they should be judged by men in the flesh but live by God in the spirit.
But the end of everything is near. Therefore be clear headed and attentive in prayer.
Above everything else have fervent love among yourselves, because love will cover many sins.
Be hospitable to one another without grumbling.
As everyone has received the gift, so serve the same to one another as good stewards of the grace of God in its many forms.

If any man speaks, then speak as the Word of God; if any one serves, then serve with the strength that God gives, so that God may be glorified in all things through Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and supremacy forever and ever. Amen.
Beloved, don't be surprised at that the fiery trial which is to test you, as if some strange thing is happening to you,
but rejoice, seeing that you are partakers of Christ's sufferings, so that when his glory will be revealed, you may also rejoice with exceeding joy.
If you are ridiculed for the name of Christ, [be] happy, for the Spirit of glory and of God rests on you. He is blasphemed by them, but glorified by you.
Let none of you suffer for being a murderer, thief, criminal, or a busybody.
Yet, if [any suffer] as a Christian, do not be ashamed instead glorify God in this matter.
For the time to begin the judgment on the house of God [is here], and if it begins at us, what will be the outcome of those who do not obey the gospel of God?
If the righteous are saved with difficulty, where will the ungodly and sinner be seen?
Therefore, let those who suffer according to the will of God continue to do what is right and give their souls for safekeeping to their faithful Creator.
